name: The Orchards Holiday Park

reviews.text: Just returned from a nightmare ,we were booked in for 7 days but left after only two.this place is dreadful.it's unclean,noisy and the facilities are non-existent.the food is a disgrace ,there's no where to relax,no where to sit and enjoy a quiet drink and the accommodation is abysmal.the beach is mudflat and the place is fully of overflowing wheely bins and flies.do not waste your money .you will regret it .when we complained,we were told we should be grateful as our accommodation had been upgraded!.upgraded well we didnt even realise,afterall the pot pourri in our bedroom was displayed in a plastic disposal meat tray!!!!
reviews.title: Avoid this place like the plague

reviews.text: Having read the reviews, I was not expecting a great deal from The Orchards. What a pleasant surprise. I went with my 3 children 17, 16 and 13 with his 14 year old friend. The staff and other holiday makers were very friendly and the site was virtually spotless. Evening entertainment was varied and enjoyable, with the indoor and outdoor pools keeping them active for most of the day. Perhaps my only gripe would be the daytime activities.... in the days when my lot were little, Haven provided a full programme of activities free of charge with just a few higher level activities which you paid a minimal extra cost for. Now it appears everything is pay as you go, with activity passes costing £36 for 6 stamps. Bearing in mind certain activities such as bike hire are 2 stamps each, you could very quickly spend a small fortune, particularly with a larger family. All in all we had a fantastic weekend and the kids have begged to return. PS. perhaps one word of warning re: wifi access... I received an urgent work request and popped to the Mash & Barrel for the free wifi only to find their server blocked most of my sites such as Dropbox and email so very limited web access available.
reviews.title: Lovely weekend, will be returning

reviews.text: We have been to the Ochards before and just use it as a base. The site is very spread out and is not contained (there is a chalet site inbetween some of the site which does not belong to the Orchards) thereby making the entertainment complex the part where you have to show your passes at all times to get in and the rest of the site 'open' to anyone.
reviews.title: Ok for kids - not much for adults

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having done three of the other sites of haven < hopton/seashore/caister> and reading the reviews on this website we wasn't expecting much from the orchards, but it exhaled expectation there were plenty to do for the kids taking into account weather was not great. The caravan was clean and the overall was very clean. The entertainment area at first glance seemed a bit small but when it came to the entertainment it was not that bad as you could actually see the stage from every angle. Both bar had lots to offer and very reasonably priced compared to the other sites. The indoor pool was smaller than the other sites but very clean plus a bigger outdoor pool with ample of staff around.
reviews.title: Too expensive.

reviews.text: Dinner at the main restaurant Mash and Barell was well priced and well prepared. would definitely recommend just a few tips: the chinese on site is exceptional, papa johns really good and do not expect much from reception always seems like they ve got too much work other not very helpful only reason am not giving a five star..
